sections.title: Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan Interest Rates

elements.body:
Dhanlaxmi Bank has set the MCLR at a benchmark rate which is effective from 7th May, 2016, for the Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan. New borrowers will be levied interest based on this system. Existing Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrowers have the option to continue with the interest based on the Base Rate or to migrate to the new MCLR lending rate system. MCLR rates are subject to change from the next reset date, as per RBI regulations. The tenure based MCLR rate is as follows:

TenureRates of Interest Rate of Interest (%) p.a.
Overnight MCLR10.05%
2 days - 1 month10.05%
More than 1 month - 3 months10.05%
More than 3 months - 6 months10.35%
More than 6 months - 1 year10.45%
More than 1 year - 2 years MCLR10.50%
More than 2 years - 3 years MCLR10.80%
More than 3 years - 5 years MCLR11.00%
More than 5 years11.20%

The existing Dhanlaxmi Bank Car Loan Base Rate = 11.40% per annum.

Self-Employed / Professionals:

Private Limited Company and Public Limited Company:

sections.title: How to calculate EMI onDhanalakshmi Bank Car Loan

elements.body:
It is a good idea to figure out the EMI before you sign your name on the cheque so you will have an idea of what exactly you are getting into. It also helps in choosing the best terms. It is easy to calculate the EMI using the car loan EMI calculator under the Finance Tools section in Bankbazaar.com.

First you should have at hand the following details: the loan amount, Rate of interest, proposed tenure and processing fee (if any).

  1. Go to Slider 1 to choose the Loan amount. Go to slider 2 to choose the tenure.
  2. In the following fields enter the interest rate and processing fee.
  3. Click on the "Calculate" button to get a detailed result which includes the EMI amount and Amortisation table. You can use these key details to make your decisions.

items.question: What is the minimum loan term that can be chosen by Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrowers?

items.question: What is the maximum tenure that can be chosen by a Dhanlaxmi Bank car loan borrower?

items.answer: The other types of additional charges that have to be paid by new car loans borrowers are - documentation charges and processing charges.

items.answer: Dhanlaxmi Bank car loans can be repaid as monthly installments via Dhanlaxmi Bank accounts, post-dated cheques, direct debits or ECS.

sections.title: How to fetch the Lowest Interest Rates on Car Loans in Bangalore

elements.body:
Lenders in Bangalore offer attractive interest rates on car loans which may vary from lender to lender but did you know that you can negotiate with the lenders to offer you the lowest interest rates? That is right. Below we give you a list of things that you can do which will help you fetch the best interest rates on car loans.

  • Compare the benefits - Before you pick a particular lender to avail a car loan, ensure that you explore the benefits offered by various lenders on their car loans. Once you have done that, compare the benefits and pick a lender that offers the lowest interest rates. Many banks offer lower interest rates to its existing customers and hence, it is a good idea to check the interest rates offered on car loans by the bank where you hold an account. Some banks may also offer lower interest rates to new customers as part of a promotion and that is why, you should always shop around before picking a lender.
  • Choose a shorter repayment tenure - Many car loan applicants make the mistake of choosing longer repayment tenures as the EMI amount is lower on them. However, opting for a longer repayment tenure may prompt lenders to increase the interest rates on the car loan because it gives an impression of the applicant having a low repayment capacity. Therefore, if you wish to negotiate with your lender for a lower interest rate, choose a shorter repayment tenure.
  • Ensure that you have a good credit score - If you have a credit score of more than 750, your chances of securing a loan is higher. There are some lenders that will offer you a car loan even if your credit score is low but will charge a high interest rate. It is recommended that you check your credit scores regularly and for free on the BankBazaar website under the 'Free Credit Score' section. Once you know your credit score and if it is above 750, you can confidently approach and negotiate with the lenders to offer you a car loan at low interest rates.
  • Maintain a low debt-to-income ratio - Lenders consider the debt-to-income ratio of the applicant along with the employment status. Whether the applicant is salaried or self-employed, they should have a steady income and a low debt-to-income ratio to avail a car loan at a lower interest rate. The debt-to-income ratio is a measure of the percentage of the applicant's income spent on repayment of loans.

items.question: Can I sell my car before I finish repaying the entire loan?
items.answer: No, you will not be able to sell your vehicle before you have repaid your loan. To sell the vehicle, you will need to get a NOC (No-Objection Certificate) from the lender which the lender will provide only if you have foreclosed the loan.

items.question: Do I have to provide any collateral or security while availing a car loan?
items.answer: There is no collateral or security that you have to provide while availing a car loan as the lender will consider the vehicle itself as collateral.

items.question: How can I pay the EMI towards my car loan?
items.answer: The repayment towards your car loan can be made in three ways - Electronic Clearing Service (ECS), Standing Instruction (SI), and Post-Dated Cheques (PDCs). The first two ways of repayment are recommended as they are quicker and is less prone to errors as compared to the PDCs.

items.question: After I am done repaying my car loan, what is the process to remove the hypothecation from the Registration Certificate (RC)?
items.answer:
To remove the hypothecation from your vehicle after you have repaid the loan, you need to visit the Regional Transport Office (RTO) and submit the below-mentioned documents:

  • NOC from the RTO and your car insurance provider
  • Original Form 35
  • NOC issued by your car loan lender

You will also have to pay a fee for removing the hypothecation from your vehicle.

items.question: Can I cancel my car loan after it is sanctioned or disbursed?
items.answer: Yes, you can cancel your car loan after its approval or disbursal but a charge of Rs.1,000 will apply. In addition to this, you may also have to pay other charges such as stamp duty charges, interest accumulation, etc.

sections.title: Why should you choose Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan'?

elements.body:
The main advantages of choosing Syndicate Bank Car Loans or 'Synd Vahan' can be summed up as follows:

Fees and Charges for Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan'

The fees and charges which are applicable to Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan' are as follows:

Eligibility criteria for Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan'

The car loan eligibility criteria differ from bank to bank. Some of the common eligibility criteria are summed up below:

faq.title: Frequently Asked Question (FAQs) on Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan'

items.question: How can I track the status of my Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan' loan?
items.answer: You can apply for a Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan' loan directly from the Syndicate Bank website. In this case you can directly track your loan status by getting in touch with the bank. On the other hand, if you have applied for a Syndicate Bank Car Loan or 'Synd Vahan' loan through a third-party website such as BankBazaar, you can log in to your profile to check the status. In case you apply for the loan through BankBazaar, you will also get regular updates on your registered email ID and phone number through email and SMS about the status of the loan. BankBazaar also has a smartphone app through which you can get push notifications.

items.question: What type of four wheelers can be purchased using Syndicate Bank Synd Vahan Car Loan?
items.answer: Syndicate Bank Car Loan can be used to purchase all types of new and second-hand four wheelers.

items.question: What extra charges will be included in the on-road price of the vehicle when calculating the loan quantum?
items.answer: On-road price includes road tax, registration charges, and insurance costs when the loan quantum is being calculated under Syndicate Bank Car Loan.

items.question: How do I get the application form for Syndicate Bank Car Loan or Synd Vahan Loan?
items.answer: An applicant who wants to apply for a Syndicate Bank Car Loan or Synd Vahan Loan will be required to collect an application form. The applicant can get the application form from one of the nearest Syndicate Bank branches or visit the official website of the bank and download the application form from the portal itself.

items.question: How do I calculate the monthly EMI amount for my Syndicate Bank Car Loan?
items.answer: You can find out the EMI on your Syndicate Bank Car Loan by using the online car loan EMI calculator offered by BankBazaar. You will have to enter details like the principal amount, processing charges if any, car loan interest rate and tenure in years.

sections.title: Car Loan in Patiala - Overview

elements.body:
Various lenders offer car loans at attractive interest rates in Patiala. Car loans are also provided for different types of cars ranging from a hatchback to an SUV. In Patiala, you can avail a car loan for a new car as well as for a used car. The repayment tenure of the car loan is flexible and the process to apply for the loan is also simple. You can apply for a car loan both offline and online.

If you are availing a car loan for a used car, the make, model, and type of car will determine the amount of loan that will be provided. Most banks and NBFCs provide a car loan for a used car only if it is less than 5 years old. However, certain lenders do not provide a loan if the car is more than 3 years old.

In Patiala, most NBFCs and banks offer car loans with a floating rate of interest. However, car loans with fixed interest rates are offered by a few lenders.

sections.title: How to Fetch Low Interest Rates in Patiala

elements.body:
• Have a good credit score: It is of utmost importance that you have a good credit score. One of the main factors that determine the interest rate is your credit score. In case your credit score is low, the interest rates will be high, or your application will be rejected. Certain banks and NBFCs do not provide a car loan if your credit score is less than 650.

Lenders will also know that you are financially stable if the credit score is good. Lenders offer car loans at attractive interest rates if your credit score is good. Therefore, it is vital that you maintain a good credit history before applying for a car loan.

  • Have a low debt-to-income ratio: Lenders will always access your debt-to-income ratio before providing a car loan. In case you have any pending Equated Monthly Installments (EMIs), it is advisable that you clear them as it would increase the chances of receiving the car loan. Lenders offer car loans at high interest rates if your debt-to-income ratio is high.
  • Compare different lenders: It is important that you compare car loans from various NBFCs and banks before you opt for one. Certain lenders offer car loans at lower interest rates when compared to others. Various third-party websites such as BankBazaar.com can be used to compare car loans from various lenders. The features and benefits of the car loan can also be compared on these sites.
  • Make a higher down payment: The loan amount provided by the lender will decrease if you make a higher down payment. Lenders also offer car loans at low interest rates in case you increase the down payment. Making a high down payment will also provide the impression that you are financially stable.
  • Negotiate: In case you have a good relationship with your bank, the interest rate can be negotiated. The interest rate can be negotiated based on various factors such as the credit score, income status, and loan tenure.
  • Choose a shorter tenure: The interest rates will be high in case you opt for a longer tenure. Banks usually offer low interest rates in case the repayment tenure is less than 5 years.

Even though the EMIs are low for a long repayment tenure, the interest rates will be high. Therefore, you will be paying a higher amount at the time of maturity. You can calculate the EMI by using the EMI Calculator provided by BankBazaar.com. You will need to enter basic details such as the processing fee, interest rate, tenure, and loan amount to calculate the EMI. The process to use the calculator is very simple.

items.question: Do I need to provide security or collateral to avail a car loan?
items.answer: No, security or collateral need not be provided when availing a car loan. The car acts as security.

items.question: Do I need to provide a co-borrower or loan guarantor to avail a car loan?
items.answer: No, a guarantor or co-borrower need not be provided when availing a car loan. However, in case you do not meet the credit criteria, the lender may request a co-borrower or guarantor to be provided.

items.question: Am I eligible for any tax benefits for availing a car loan?
items.answer: No, you cannot avail any tax benefits for availing a car loan.

items.question: Can I include my spouse's income when calculating the loan amount?
items.answer: Yes, you can include your spouse's income when calculating the loan amount.

items.question: Can 100% financing be availed on a used car?
items.answer: Yes, few lenders offer 100% finance on the ex-showroom price of certain models. However, you must meet the eligibility criteria to avail 100% finance.

elements.body: RBL Bank is one of the fastest growing commercial banks that is continuing its expansion rapidly. RBL Bank currently has 183 branches and 351 ATMS that span across 18 states in India. RBL Bank offers a variety of credit cards designed to suit the different needs of people. Avail of credit cards that are designed specifically for golf enthusiasts, cricket fans, shoppers, diners and entertainment freaks. Enjoy credit periods of up to 50 days on your credit card. Pay it back at your convenience of only the minimum amount due or the full amount. Choose to revolve your credit at finance charges of up to 3.4% per month. Each card has delightful features on offer that includes reward points, cash advances, fuel surcharges, add on cards and more.

sections.title: Why Choose RBL Bank Credit Card?

elements.body: RBL credit cards cater to a wide variety of customers. Whether you need a basic credit card or an elite card, RBL has it all on offer. The credit cards are packed with benefits that are designed to suit different needs and wants of people. The cards focus on anti-fraud, flexible credit limits, cash advances, reward points, and specialized privileges. Be a part of hand-picked rewards, cash back, discounts, concierge services and personalised offers.

elements.prefix: Did you know that Mr. Kumar's Credit Card gets him free movie tickets every month?

sections.title: List of RBL Bank Credit Card:

elements.body:
• Insignia Preferred Banking World Card: This card is designed to pamper and treat you to comfort and luxury. The card carries innumerable benefits and privileges that include grand hotel stays, curated rewards, luxurious holidays, delectable culinary experiences and more created especially for you.
  • IGU NHS Golf World Card: This card is designed for the golf enthusiast, aspiring golfers and young golfers. Get golfing benefits that never end which includes membership into NHS, complimentary golf rounds, unlimited golf lessons, discounted Green Fees and golf accessories.
  • Platinum Maxima Card: Enjoy benefits worth Rs. 20,000, airport lounge access, bonus reward points and free movie tickets with this credit card. Earn rewards while you spend and redeem them for a host of products and vouchers.
  • RBL Bank Fun+ Credit Card: Designed for fun and entertainment, this card is brought to you in association with KFC, Pizza Hut and BookMyShow. Get welcome offers and complimentary vouchers with this credit card.
  • Platinum Delight Card: Earn rewards and more rewards with your Platinum Delight card. Get 4,000 points when you swipe within 60 days of card issuance.
  • Platinum Cricket Card: A card designed for sports enthusiasts, The Platinum Cricket Credit Card gives you a unique opportunity to enjoy the game with the Delhi Daredevils. Get privileges and perks that include reserved seats and party invites.
  • Titanium Delight Card: Earn rewards while you spend. The credit card comes with a host of benefits such as an annual fee waiver if you spend Rs. 1 lakh in the first year. Earn 2,000 reward points when you swipe within 2 months of card issuance.
  • Classic Shopper Cards: This card comes in three options: Titanium Card, Freedom Titanium Card and Freedom Titanium Cash Back Card. Earn 2 reward points for every Rs. 100 spent.
  • Classic Reward Cards: Earn accelerated rewards with this credit card. Get 4 points for every Rs. 100 spent domestically. Get your points doubled when you spend abroad earning 8 points for every Rs. 100 you spend.
  • Classic Platinum Card: This Classic card lets you earn 2 reward points for every Rs. 100 spent domestically. Spend internationally to earn 4 reward points for every Rs. 100 spent.

sections.title: Features and Benefits of RBL Bank Credit Card:

elements.body:
• Enhanced Protection:

    RBL Bank offers credit cards that are embedded with an EMV Microchip which enhances protection against misuse and duplication. The card is also PIN enabled which is a Personal Identification Number. This number is required to authenticate your transactions at merchant outlets. For online transactions, a one-time password is required to verify your transactions.

  • Active Alerts:

    Be up to date on all your transaction, payment date missed, receipt of bill payment, monthly card statement and more with SMS and email alerts sent regularly.

  • Flexible Credit Limits:

    RBL Bank offers a unique feature on its credit cards which allows you to curb the spending limits on your credit card. You can also set credit limits on your add on cards to suit the needs of your family members.

  • Online Banking:

    Access your credit card account online anywhere and at any time. Enjoy easy and convenient access to bank statements, unbilled purchases, view up to 6 months statements, credit card due dates and more. You can also request for EMI options and balance transfers.

  • 24/7 Customer Care:

    With RBL Bank, your problems will be resolved quickly and conveniently with the help of the 24/7 customer care service. Call on the toll-free hotline for any queries or issues you may have regarding your RBL Bank credit card.

  • Reward points:

    RBL Bank rewards you when you spend on your credit card. Get welcome points, bonus points and accelerated rewards on select RBL Bank credit cards. Collect and redeem your points from a range of vouchers, products, flights, hotels and much more.

  • Cash Advance:

    Get cash any time you need with your RBL Bank credit card. Visit any ATM that displays the logo of Mastercard, Maestro or Cirrus to make a withdrawal anywhere in the world. Cash transactions will attract a fee and finance charges from the date of transaction.

  • Add-on cards:

    RBL offers supplementary cards for your family members. You can avail of up to 5 cards for your spouse, parents and children. Set the credit limits for each card as per your requirements.

  • No Fraud Liability:

    In case you lose your RBL Bank credit card, you can report the loss to the customer care immediately. After reporting, you will not be held liable for any fraudulent transactions carried out on your credit card.

  • Specialized Privileges:

    Select cards carry specialized benefits that include priority pass membership, lounge access, dining privileges, golfing lessons, golf memberships, travel and flight benefits and more.

items.question: What should I do in case I lose my RBL Bank credit card?
items.answer: If you lose your RBL Bank credit card, immediately contact the 24-hour toll free customer care provided by RBL Bank. Report the lost or stolen card to the customer care. Once this is done, you will not be held liable for any transactions made on your card after.

items.question: How do I pay my RBL Bank credit card bill?
items.answer:
You can use any of the following methods to make payments towards your credit card.

  • NEFT - You can use the National Electronic Funds Transfer option. Transfer funds using the IFSC code to your credit card account.
  • Cheque - Deposit a cheque at any designated Credit Card Payment boxes at an RBL Bank branch. You can also use drop boxes offered by Skypak.
  • Cash - Visit any RBL Bank branch to make a payment in cash. Rs. 100 is charged for this service.
  • Cards Online - Log into the online portal “Cards Online” to pay your credit card bill.
  • Quick Bill Pay - Pay your credit card bill using “Quick Bill Pay” from any bank account.
  • ECS or Standing Instructions - Pay your credit card bill easily by setting standing instructions with RBL Bank to automatically debit your account to pay the minimum amount due or the full credit card bill on the payment due date.

items.question: What is the credit and cash advance limits available on RBL Bank credit cards?
items.answer: Your eligible credit limit depends on the card of your choice and your income bracket. Your cash limit will be a percentage of the available or total credit limit. This limit will be indicated on the billing statement of your credit card every month.

items.question: Why do I need add-on cards?
items.answer: Add-on cards can be taken for your family members which includes only your spouse, parents and children. You can share the benefits and convenience of a credit card with your family members. These cards will be issued under the primary card. All charges will be billed to the primary card. Reward points accumulated will also be credited to the main card. You have full control over these cards as to the credit limit you would like to allow for each add-on card.

items.question: Where can I use my RBL Bank Credit Card?
items.answer: You can use an RBL Bank credit card domestically and internationally. The card is valid at any merchant and ATM which accepts MasterCard, Maestro and Cirrus. You can also use your card to shop online.

elements.body:
In the year 1994, Axis Bank, a private sector bank, began operations as one of the first new generation banks in India. In 1993, it was jointly promoted by several organisations. Among all the private sector banks in India, Axis Bank ranks third. It caters to MSME, Agriculture, Large and Medium Corporates and Retail Businesses. Axis Bank has 2402 branches and 12922 ATMs spread all over the country.

A credit card can be of great help, if and when used wisely. The credit amount is readily available and the payments can be made immediately. In case of an emergency, it can prove to be extremely useful. There are 11 varieties of credit cards offered by Axis Bank for its customers.

Customers can choose a card that fits them the best and enjoy attractive offers and rewards on each and every credit card purchase.

Axis Bank Signature Credit Card with Lifestyle Benefits

Upgrade your lifestyle and enjoy top class benefits. Axis Bank Credit Card with Lifestyle Benefits is definitely the key-card to the gateway of a classy life.

Axis Signature Credit Card with Travel Benefits

If travelling is your passion, this is definitely the card you should get. Axis Bank Signature Credit Card with Travel benefits is absolutely the 'magic carpet' for you and will fulfil your dream of being a traveller.

Features and Benefits of Axis Signature Credit Card with Travel Benefits :

  • Refuel your vehicle at any station across India and enjoy fuel surcharge refund.

Axis Bank Miles & More Credit Card

Neither your miles nor your smiles ever expire. If you are a frequent flyer with Lufthansa, Austrian airlines, Swiss Air or any other airline service that falls under this category then this is a must-get card for you. This card is directly linked to your Miles & More Mileage account. It has several benefits for a cardholder and a member.

Features and Benefits Miles & More Credit Card:

  • Getting a home loan is pretty easy with this card. You can save up a lot of money using this card when you buy a house or invest in a property.
  • You can transfer credit balance from other cards to your Axis Bank Miles & More Credit Card. This helps you save up a lot.

Axis Bank MY Choice Credit Card

If you want a personalised credit card and design it the way you want with your choice of benefits, look no further. This Axis bank my choice card caters to your saving needs and also gives you spending benefits. Craft your own card and make it what you want it to be.

Features and Benefits of Axis Bank MY Choice Credit Card:

  • Pick any two from Dining, Fuel, Electronics, Utility bills, Travel and Supermarkets and you can get a 5% cashback on them.
  • You can earn 4 points for every 200 INR that you spend. A straight 100 points can be earned on your first online transaction.

Axis MY Zone Credit Card

This card offers you a great time when you are out shopping, dining or at a movie. It is the ultimate fun-seeker for you. The rewards are too good to resist. In short, this card is your best buddy when you are out with friends.

Features and Benefits of Axis MY Zone Credit Card:

  • The EMV certified chip gives this card a top notch security status.
  • Your eDGE loyalty points multiply by 10 times when you use your Axis Bank MY Zone Credit Card for dining out on weekends.
  • Your eDGE loyalty points multiply by 5 times when you use your Axis Bank MY Zone Credit Card at supermarkets or apparel store on weekends.
  • 25% cashback on purchase of both online and box office tickets for movies.

Axis MY Wings Credit Card

This particular credit card is extremely beneficial if you travel a lot. Whether it is a bus, train or flight it does not matter since this card will definitely come in handy for all your travel purposes.

Features and Benefits of Axis MY Wings Credit Card:

  • You will be entitled to two base fare flight tickets.
  • You will get 20% cashback on base fares for booking domestic flights.
  • Every time you use your MY Wings Credit Card on the IRCTC website you get a discount of 25 INR.
  • Every bus ticket you book using the card, gets you an INR 100 cashback.
  • 400 INR cashback can be earned by booking a car from any car rental in India.

Axis Bank MY Business Credit Card

MY Business Credit Card is best suited for the business banking customers of Axis Bank. The offers available with this card help customers manage businesses efficiently. The card comes with low interest rates, substantial savings and much more.

Features and Benefits of Axis Bank MY Business Credit Card:

  • The card offers 20% cashback on base fares of flight bookings on ezeego1.com.
  • 500 INR cashback on domestic return flight bookings and 1500 INR cashback on international return flight bookings.
  • You can earn 4 points for every 200 INR you spend from your card. You are entitled to a 100 points on your first online transaction.
  • You can enjoy complimentary access to several airport lounges across the country, twice in every three months.
  • You can get 30% cash from your credit limit even when you are overseas.

Axis Bank Titanium Smart Traveler Credit Card

Axis Bank Titanium Smart Traveler Credit Card is very beneficial from people who travel. This card will definitely make your journey a happy one.

Features and Benefits of Axis Bank Titanium Smart Traveler Credit Card:

  • You can earn 8 eDGE loyalty points for every 200 INR you spend while travelling abroad.
  • In India, you can earn 4 eDGE loyalty points for every 200 INR you spend on booking hotels, buses, flights etc.
  • 2.5% fuel surcharge waiver on all fuel transactions.
  • The protection is top notch and you are safe from fraud attacks.

Axis Bank Platinum Credit Card

Axis Bank Platinum Credit Card offers several benefits such as cashbacks, loyalty points, etc. and hence this card is definitely very useful.

Features and Benefits of Axis Bank Platinum Credit Card :

  • The EMV certified chip provides added security and consumer protection.
  • You can get a 25% cashback on both online and box office movie ticket purchases.
  • Axis Bank will replace the card is case of loss or theft of card. The Global Emergency Assistance feature is extremely useful.
  • You can earn 6 eDGE loyalty points for every 200 INR that you spend domestically and 12 points for every 200 INR spent internationally.

Axis Bank Insta Easy Credit Card

You need minimal documents to get this credit card. The card can be availed at any Axis Bank branch, provided you have a fixed deposit of minimum 20000 INR in Axis Bank. A lot many rewards and benefits are associated with this card.

Features and Benefits of Axis Bank Insta Easy Credit Card:

  • This card offers a great amount of security. The Platinum chip is extremely effective against fraud.
  • Insta Easy card offers upto 100% cash withdrawal.
  • Every 200 INR you spend domestically, you earn 6 eDGE loyalty points and every 200 INR you spend internationally, you earn 12 eDGE loyalty points.
  • The credit limit is pretty flexible. You can decide your own credit limit.

Axis Bank Shriram Credit Card

This is a co-branded credit card. Axis Bank launched it in association with Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited (STFCL). Shriram card is only for STFCL customers. The customers should have a good track record. The card is very useful for transport operators. They can buy oil, tyres, batteries, etc. and can make use of VISA merchant outlets across India.

Features and Benefits of Shriram Credit Card:

  • 1 reward point is earned on spending 100 INR.
  • Credit shield amount is 15000 INR.
  • Lost card liability is 15000 INR.
  • The cardholder can have his own photo on the credit card.

Axis Bank Credit Card Tips

Uncommon reasons for Credit Card rejection

Have a good Credit Score but your Credit Card application was rejected? Here are the possible reasons. Yet to apply for a credit card? Go ahead. Do it now.

Playing With Cards

Love having multiple Credit Cards? Applying for too many Credit Cards at the same time can lead to several rejections.

What's In Your Pocket?

Credit Card issuers look at how much money you make. If you have low income, the chances of rejection are high.

Don't Keep It Short

The shorter your Credit history, the higher will be the probability that your application might get rejected. A long enough Credit history is important to get that Credit Card.

Not That One

CIBIL is not the only Credit Information Company. There are others. Though the score might be the same across all companies, errors could creep in. Correct them (if any) before you apply.

Got wiser? Then, it's time to apply for that Credit Card. We have some amazing offers for you!

4 Reasons You Must Get a Credit Card Today

After the demonetisation drive, a large number of people have started using their Credit Cards. Are you one of them? Or wait, don't have a Credit Card yet? This is the time to go for one

Racing Ahead

According to news reports, Credit Card usage in the country has gone up by 40% after the demonetisation drive.

Small Tickets

The number of people swiping their card for transactions less than Rs. 500 has gone up by 65%

Big Fish

There was a whopping 75% jump in the number of users who swiped more than Rs. 500.

Huge Rush?

Banks have reported a sharp spike in the number of Credit Card applications, since November 8, 2016. There are about 754 million Credit and Debit card users in the country.

Want to join the herd? Go ahead and get yourself a Credit Card today. We have plenty of them to choose from.

Swiping your Credit Card is fun! But paying the bill?

Naah! Making a minimum payment on your Credit Card bill might not be one of the best decisions of your life. Why? Find out:

Goodbye, good Credit Score

Minimum payments are a great quick-fix for your financial crisis. But underpaying can damage your Credit Score, genius!

Fatter Credit Card bills

If you keep making minimum Credit Card payments, be ready to see a whopping balance figure later. Want that? No, right?

Growing Credit Card costs

Not paying on time is a bad move! Why? The unpaid balance on your card keeps accumulating interest. Convinced now?

Debt alert

You might be a great swimmer. But we're pretty sure you won't be able to stay afloat in a sea of debt! Short-term arrangements can invite trouble.

Thinking your moves through is the best move you can ever make! Use your plastic buddy well. Still looking for your friend with benefits?

EMI Payments Simplified

Thinking of making a big purchase, but don't want to burn a hole in your pocket? We have just the solution for you. Get a Credit Card and choose to pay through EMIs.

What Is An EMI?

An Equated Monthly Instalment is the amount of money paid back to the lender or bank on a monthly basis. This amount is paid until the total amount due including interest is paid.

Factors Affecting The EMI Amount

What is the total loan amount? What is the rate of interest charged on your loan? What is the tenure of the loan? These are the important factors that affect the EMI amount.

Two Parts Of An EMI

There are two components in an EMI. The principal amount and the interest rate. The interest rate is higher during the first few years, but reduces over the tenure of your loan.

Tenure & Loan Amount

If your loan amount is high, the EMI you need to pay will be higher. If you choose a longer tenure, the rate of interest on your loan will be higher.

Haven't we simplified EMIs for you? Now get started by choosing your perfect Credit Card.

*Terms and conditions apply. Credit at the sole discretion of the bank.

faq.title: FAQ's on Axis Bank credit cards

items.question: What are the different types of credit cards offered by Axis Bank?
items.answer:
Axis Bank offers a wide choice of credit cards specially designed to suit individual needs. They come under four major categories.

  • Premium Cards
  • MY Cards
  • Co-branded Cards
  • Other Cards

Some of the popular credit cards offered by Axis Bank include Platinum Credit Card, Signature Credit Card with travel benefits, MY Business Credit Card and Miles & More Credit Card.

items.question: What are some of the benefits offered by Axis Bank credit cards?
items.answer:
Cardholders get exclusive privileges and offers based on their credit card type. However, here are some of the benefits that are common to all cardholders.

  • Option to convert purchases to EMI
  • Zero lost card liability up to credit limit
  • EMV certified chip credit cards for additional security
  • Complimentary insurance cover with premium cards
  • Loyalty Reward Program
  • Cashback offers on selected spending categories
  • 24/7 customer assistance for all cardholders

items.question: What are the documents required for completing the application process?
items.answer:
The documents required usually vary on a case to case basis. However, the following documents are mandatory for completing the application process.

  • Photocopy of PAN card and Form 60
  • Copy of income proof - Latest payslips or Form 16 or IT return copy
  • ID proof and proof of residence

items.question: Can I apply for an Axis Bank Credit Card?
items.answer: If you are a resident of India in the age bracket of 18 to 70 years, you satisfy the primary eligibility criteria. However, for different cards, the minimum required net income varies. Please check with the bank about the income criteria for respective credit cards before applying.

items.question: How can I convert my purchases to EMI?
items.answer: Whenever you make a transaction of Rs. 2,500 and above, you can convert it to EMI's with tenures at 3, 6, 9 or 12 months with low interest rates. You can use the Net Banking facility or the customer care service to convert the payments to EMI.

items.question: Can I have a supplementary Axis Bank credit card?
items.answer: Supplementary or add-on card is an additional card that is offered against your existing Axis Bank credit card with all the features of the parent card. You can apply for up to 4 add-on cards by contacting any Axis Bank branch.

items.question: What is "Zero Lost Card Liability"?
items.answer: If your Axis Bank credit card is misplaced or stolen, you will be free from any fraudulent purchase transaction charges up to the insured amount from the moment you report the loss to Axis Bank customer care or the VISA Global service helpline.

items.question: Which Axis Bank credit card offers the EMI option?
items.answer: All credit cards offered by Axis Bank come with this option.

items.question: Can I use my credit card to withdraw cash from the ATM?
items.answer: Yes. You can use your Axis Bank Signature credit cards to withdraw cash up to 30% of the prescribed credit limit from all the ATM's that display the Visa sign.

items.question: How do I pay my Axis Bank credit card bills?
items.answer: You can pay the bills by many easy ways like Net Banking, NEFT transfer, Electronic Clearing Service (ECS), auto debit, cheque or by cash.

items.question: For a frequent air traveller like me, what would be the most suitable Axis Bank credit card?
items.answer: Axis Bank Miles & More credit card. You stand to earn unlimited miles that never expire and use your miles to avail exciting offers on flight tickets and upgrades, hotels and car rentals.

items.question: How do I use the reward points that I get on each credit card transaction?
items.answer: With Axis Bank's eDGE rewards program, you can spend your reward points for purchasing over 500 chosen reward items.

items.question: I travel a lot within India. Which credit card would be apt for me?
items.answer: Axis Bank's MY Wings credit card that comes with benefits like 20% cashback on domestic flights, Rs.25 off on IRCTC booking, Rs.100 cashback on domestic bus tickets and Rs.400 off on domestic car rentals would be the perfect choice.

items.question: What are some of the benefits of Axis Bank Platinum credit card?
items.answer: Platinum cardholders get to enjoy exclusive privileges like 25% cash back on movie tickets, global emergency assistance, fuel surcharge waiver and eDGE loyalty rewards.

elements.body:
Agartala is the capital of Tripura and the second largest city in the state. It is one of the fastest growing cities in the north east of India, pulling in people from different walks of life for employment and career opportunities

Home loans, also known as mortgages, use the borrower's home for collateral. This home can be a single-family house up to a four-unit property, as well as a cooperative unit. Lenders fund home loans, but both the lenders themselves and brokers who act on behalf of the lenders originate, or process, them.

sections.title: Axis Bank Home Loan Calculator

elements.body:
Calculating your EMI (equated monthly instalment) will help you plan your finances once you take the loan. In order to calculate, you can use the BankBazaar Axis Bank Housing Loan EMI Calculator.

This easy-to-use online tool lets you calculate your monthly instalments in a quick manner. All you need to do is enter all your loan-related details, including the loan amount, tenure, applicable rate, and processing fee. After that, hit the button "calculate" to view the EMI amount.

This will be followed by an amortisation table where you can view a detailed breakdown of your payment schedule.

You can get the benefits of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) scheme through Shubh Aarambh and Power Advantage schemes. The benefits of PMAY include:

items.question: What type of interest rates does Axis Bank offer?
items.answer: The bank offers both fixed and floating rate loans. In case of floating rate loans, the interest rate will change with a change in the bank's MCLR (Marginal Cost of Funds-based Lending Rate). The rate remains fixed throughout the tenure in case of fixed rate loans.

items.question: Can I pay a higher principal loan amount at the beginning of the loan tenure?
items.answer: If you sign up for the QuikPay scheme, you can pay a higher principal amount so as to reduce the burden of interest.

items.question: Can I transfer the outstanding loan from another bank to Axis Bank?
items.answer: Yes, some of the home financing schemes offer balance transfer facility. You can transfer the outstanding amount to Axis and pay off the loan at lower rates.

items.question: Are all the schemes available for salaried individuals?
items.answer: All the schemes excluding the Empower Home Loan are available for salaried individuals. The Empower scheme is only for self-employed professionals and non-professionals.

items.question: How much interest subsidy will I get under the PMAY scheme?
items.answer: You can get an interest subsidy of 6.50% p.a. depending on the income group/segment you belong to.

items.question: How can I get my EMIs waived off?
items.answer: Axis bank offers a few schemes like Asha and Shubh Aarambh where you can get 12 EMIs waived off, provided you have a good repayment history.

items.question: What's the minimum amount that I can borrow?
items.answer: The minimum amount you can borrow is Rs.1 lakh.

items.question: Can I add a co-applicant to get the loan?
items.answer: Yes, you can apply jointly with a co-applicant.

items.question: Can I change my fixed rate loan to floating rate or vice versa?
items.answer: Yes, you can switch from a floating rate loan to a fixed rate loan. However, you have to pay certain additional charges for that.

sections.title: Overview of Max Bupa Health Insurance:

elements.body:
Company Ltd. (Max Bupa) is a collaboration between Max India Limited and Bupa- the UK based healthcare services pioneer. Bupa boasts of an experience of over 6 decades in this competitive industry and has over 11.3 million customers from 190 countries to show for it. Meanwhile, Max India Group is considered a leader in the Indian health and insurance segment that includes hospitals, life insurance and health related clinical research. At Max Bupa, the vision to be India's most preferred health insurance company is the principal driving force, backed by the commitment to form lasting relationships with their cherished customers.

Max Bupa Health Insurance Company Ltd was the only health insurance company to be listed as a Superbrand in the health insurance market in 2015. This standalone health insurance company has 6 decades of experience and expertise in the healthcare industry. Max Bupa Health caters to 29 million customers in 190 countries.

In addition to providing excellent service in healthcare, the company is focused on building a long-term relationship with its customers. The insurance company offers a wide range of health insurance products to suit the varying needs of individuals, couples, nuclear families, and extended families. Listed below are some highlights of Max Bupa Health Insurance:

  • The insurer won the ET Best BFSI Brands Award in 2016 for its 'Customer First' philosophy, innovation, strong equity in the market, and unique products like Max Bupa Walk for Health.
  • Max Bupa Heartbeat Health Insurance was recognised as the Innovation of the Year at Golden Peacock Awards 2015
  • Max Bupa was declared the 'Claim Service Leader of the Year' Award in 2015 at the 5th Indian Insurance Awards.

Over 2.5 million people have been insured with Max Bupa Health Insurance. The company has over 1,400 employees, 26 offices in 16 cities.

sections.title: Why Buy Max Bupa Health Insurance Policy?

elements.body:
Here are some reasons why customers prefer Max Bupa Health Insurance for their health insurance needs:

  • Cashless hospitalisation: Max Bupa Health Insurance offers cashless hospitalisation at 3,500+ network hospitals across India within 30 minutes of receiving the request from the hospital.
  • Comprehensive insurance cover: Max Bupa offers health insurance policies with a sum insured of up to Rs.1 crore. The insurance coverage has low waiting periods.
  • International coverage: Max Bupa Heartbeat Platinum plan is a unique product that offers international cashless treatment for 9 major critical illnesses like organ transplant and cancer through its global network in over 190 countries. Outpatient Department cover is available under this plan.
  • Maternity benefits: Health insurance plans offered by Max Bupa covers maternity related expenses after a 1-year waiting period. A baby born when a maternity claim is payable is automatically covered till the next policy renewal.
  • Health plans for entire family: Max Bupa offers health insurance plans for the entire family from newborn babies to senior citizens under a single policy.
  • Lifelong renewability: All health insurance plans offered by Max Bupa comes with a lifelong renewability option, provided continuous payment of insurance premium.

sections.title: Benefits of Max Bupa Health Insurance:

elements.body:
• Daily cash benefit: For miscellaneous expenses, you can get a daily cash benefit of up to Rs.4,000 per day during the hospitalisation period up to 45 days.
  • Direct claim settlement: There is no involvement of a TPA. Therefore, the claim settlement is direct and quick.
  • World-wide coverage: Insured members can get cashless treatment at a network hospital of Max Bupa Health Insurance anywhere in the world.
  • Renewability for life: All health insurance policies offered by Max Bupa have lifelong renewability option.
  • Discount: Get a discount upon purchasing a 2-year policy. Discount on premium applicable on select policies offered by Max Bupa Health Insurance and that too only in the second year of the policy term.
  • Critical illness plan: A lump sum amount will be paid to the insured in the case of diagnosis of a specified critical illness under the policy, provided he or she survives for 30 days post diagnosis.
  • Personal accident plan: With this rider attached to your base policy, you can get sum insured payout benefit in the case of an accident death, permanent total disability or partial disability.
  • Tax benefit: Get tax deduction on premium paid towards a health insurance policy under Section 80D of the Income Tax Act, 1961.

sections.title: Types of Health Insurance Policies Provided by Max Bupa Health Insurance:

elements.body:
Policies forming a part of the company's health insurance plans portfolio are listed below:

  1. Max Bupa Heartbeat Health Insurance Plan
  2. Max Bupa Health Companion Policy
  3. Max Bupa Health Assurance Plan

sections.title: Health Insurance Plans for Individuals & Nuclear Families (You, Spouse and 2 Children):

elements.body:
Heartbeat at Max Bupa, it?s all about simplifying the complexities associated with health insurance. The aptly named Heartbeat is an easy plan to understand, to buy, and provides comprehensive health coverage for you and your family, to the tune of Rs.1 Crore.

Note that the Heartbeat Health Insurance Plan can also be applied to the traditional Indian joint family wherein upto 14 relationships are covered, with individual sum insured for each member of the group and a floater sum insured that can be used for any of the insured family members.

Max Bupa Heartbeat Health Insurance Plan:

Max Bupa Heartbeat Health Insurance Plan all about simplifying the complexities associated with health insurance. The aptly named Heartbeat is an easy plan to understand, to buy, and provides comprehensive health coverage for you and your family, to the tune of Rs.1 Crore.

Entry AgeRight from birth to 65 years
Right from birth to 65 yearsIndividual / Family floater
Policy PeriodOne or Two Years

RenewabilityLifelong

Cashless Treatment3500+ hospitals

Health Relationship Loyalty Program-Irrespective of claims raised, we offer you two reward programs to choose from- A) Earn & Redeem, B) Increase Sum Assured.

Max Bupa Health Companion Policy:

It's difficult to predict the various ups and downs in life. Especially, when it comes to illness and health scares, a badly timed ailment could completely deplete all your hard earned savings and maybe, push you into debt as well. Max Bupa?s Health@Companion plan is designed for all such eventualities- keeping you and your family protected with a robust health insurance, while also safeguarding your savings against the onslaught of unexpected medical expenses.

Direct & Simple Claim Settlement-We have in place a simple system of claims settlement that allows you to talk directly to us and not some third party.
Cashless TreatmentAvail cashless treatment at a wide network of quality hospitals across India.
Assured Policy Renewal for LifeGuaranteed policy renewal for life, at no extra loading based on your claims history.
Try It before You Buy ItAfter purchasing the Max Bupa health insurance, and in the super rare condition of not being completely impressed by it, you can return the policy back to us with a simple explanation and your investment will be promptly returned back to you.
Tax SavingsUnder Section 80D of the Income Tax Act.
24x7 Access to your PolicyOur customer support team and helpline are at hand to address all your queries and concern

Max Bupa Health Assurance Plan:

Max Bupa Health Assurance Plan is a unique fixed benefit plan that helps you financially through sudden eventualities like accidents, illness (both general and critical) and other instances that require hospitalization. Peace of mind guaranteed!!

sections.title: Max Bupa Health Insurance Renewal:

elements.body: All health insurance policies offered by Max Bupa Health Insurance have to be renewed every policy year for continued policy benefits. A 30-day grace period will be given post premium payment due date to make renewal payment. However, policy benefits will not be available during the grace period. If the policyholder fails to renew the policy within the grace period, the policy will lapse. Policy renewal can be done online through the insurer's website. Enter your policy number on the website to know the renewal premium amount and pay using net banking, credit card or debit card.

sections.title: Max Bupa Health Insurance Premium Calculator:

elements.body: With Max Bupa Health Insurance premium calculator, you can assess your insurance needs and choose a suitable health insurance policy for you and your family. The online premium calculator is simple and easy to use. It is available on the insurer's website. All you have to do is choose a specific plan, enter the chosen sum insured, your personal details such as name, date of birth, city, phone number, and email ID. If you choose co-pay, list how much percentage you are willing to pay. Click on Calculate Premium and get the premium details instantly.

sections.title: Max Bupa Health Insurance Customer Care:

elements.body:
For any policy-related queries or assistance with purchasing a policy from Max Bupa Health Insurance, call toll-free number 1800 3010 3333 or 011 66326666. You can also email customercare@maxbupa.com or send a letter to Max Bupa Health Insurance Company Limited, B-1/I-2, Mohan Cooperative Industrial Estate, Mathura Road, New Delhi - 110044.

  • Branch Office: Visit the official website of Max Bupa Health Insurance and click on 'Contact Us' tab on the top right-hand corner of the page. A list of contact details of the branch offices of Max Bupa will be displayed on the screen.
  • Network hospital: Locate a network hospital in your area by selecting a state and city from the dropdown box. You can also view the map for directions to the nearest network hospital.
  • Customer Support: Under the Customer Support option, you can find the following services:
    • Track your claim status
    • Information on claim process
    • Download claim forms
    • Grievance redressal
    • Change your contact details
    • Policy documents
  • Tax receipt: You can access your tax receipt by entering your policy number, date of birth, and email ID.
  • Portability: You can find information on how to port your health insurance policy from one insurer to another without losing your accrued policy benefits such as waiting period and No-Claim Bonus.

elements.linkText: Max Bupa Health Insurance Customer Care Number

sections.title: Max Bupa Cashless Network Hospitals:

elements.body: Max Bupa Health Insurance offers cashless facility at more than 3,500 network hospitals across India. If you have opted for cashless hospitalisation, then locate a network hospital near you using the online network hospital locator tool. Just enter your place of residence such as city and state. The tool will give you a list of network hospitals in your area with its contact details. Max Bupa approves cashless hospitalisation request within 30 minutes of receiving the form from the hospital.

sections.title: How to file a claim with Max Bupa Health Insurance?

elements.body:
There are 2 types of claims you can file with Max Bupa:

  • Cashless Claim: Visit a network hospital and show your health card with policy number and a valid photo identity at the hospital desk. The network hospital will verify your identity and submit a pre-authorisation request to the insurer or TPA. The insurance company or its Third-Party Administrator will process the request and send approval to the hospital. In the case of a rejection, the insured member can get treated at the same hospital but has to pay the medical bills out of his or her pocket, and later make a reimbursement claim for the expenses incurred. In the case of approval, the insurance company will settle the bill directly with the hospital.
  • Reimbursement Claim: In the case of planned hospitalisation, intimate the insurer 48 hours prior to admission. Pay the medical bills upfront, out of your pocket. At the time of discharge, collect all the original medical documents and submit it to the insurer along with a duly-filled and signed claim form which is available on the insurance company's website. The claim will be processed and approved as per the terms and conditions of the policy.

items.question: Why is it important to buy health insurance policy?
items.answer: A health insurance policy helps you to save money by paying off all your medical expenses. With the rising medical expenses, it is a wise move to insure you and your family's health by buying health insurance policies. You can get cashless hospitalization for more than 24 hours with the help of these policies.

items.question: What is a health card?
items.answer: A health card is a part of your health insurance policy. This card enables you to enjoy the benefits of your health insurance policy.

items.question: How do I get cashless hospitalization?
items.answer: You can get cashless hospitalization only in the network hospitals of Max Bupa by showing your health card to the hospital authority.

items.question: What the difference between a network and non-network hospital?
items.answer: A network hospital is a hospital with which your health insurance provider has an official connection. You can enjoy cashless hospitalization in a network hospital. In a non- network hospital, you cannot avail cashless hospitalization and with this hospital, your health insurance provider does not have any tie up.

items.question: As I already have health insurance for myself and my wife from my employer, do I need to buy a separate policy?
items.answer: It's good to buy an alternative health insurance policy to be on the safe side. Because, once you leave or change your present job, your company insurance policy will not cover you and your wife's medical expense. Beside, a separate policy can be an added advantage in case your medical expense is higher than your existing coverage level.

items.question: What is a family floater plan?
items.answer: It is a plan under which you can include the hospitalization expense of your entire family.

items.question: How can I buy Max Bupa Health Insurance Policy?
items.answer: There are many options of buying Max Bupa health insurance policies. You can buy them online.Then you will get your policy instantly. But online facility is available for those people only, who do not need any medical examination. You can also buy Max Bupa health insurance policies over phone or by visiting your nearest branch.

items.question: Do I need to undergo medical examination to buy Max Bupa health insurance policies?
items.answer: You need to undergo medical checkup, if you are buying a new health insurance policy offered by Max Bupa. But for the renewal of your existing policies, you need not go for medical examination.

items.question: What is the duration of health insurance policies offered by Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: Ideally, you can buy a policy for a period of 1 or 2 years. If you purchase a policy for two years, you will get discount. This offer is applicable for Heartbeat and Health Companion Health Insurance plans only.

items.question: Can a non- Indian person buy Max Bupa Health Insurance policy?
items.answer: Yes, a non - Indian or a foreigner living in India can also buy health insurance policies offered by Max Bupa. But, the person can claim coverage only within India.

items.question: How to claim Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer:
Max Bupa Health Insurance offers a seamless claims procedure:

  • Cashless claim procedure: Cashless hospitalisation can be availed only in a network hospital. For planned hospitalisation, inform the insurer 48 hours prior to admission and for emergency hospitalisation, intimate the insurer within 24 hours of admission. Display your Max Bupa Health Card at the hospital desk. The hospital will submit a pre-authorisation request to the insurer. The approval or rejection of the request will be conveyed to the hospital via fax or email within 30 minutes. The claim will be settled as per the terms and conditions of the policy.
  • Reimbursement claim procedure: Intimate the insurer within 48 hours of hospitalisation. Submit a claim form along with supporting documents such as original hospital bills, prescription, pharmacy bills, and discharge summary to the insurer. The claim form can be downloaded from Max Bupa Health Insurance website. The insurance company will review the claim request and according approve or reject it. Claim settlement will be done as per the terms and conditions of the policy.

items.question: How good is Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: Max Bupa is one of the top health insurance providers in the country. The health insurance plans offered by Max Bupa are designed for individuals, couples, senior citizens, and families. The health plans offer a comprehensive cover and a wide sum insured range. The policies come with a lifelong renewability option. The claim process is hassle-free with no TPA involved.

items.question: What is the tenure of a health insurance plan offered by Max Bupa?
items.answer: Max Bupa Health Insurance plans are available for 1 to 2-years policy period. The policy has to be renewed every year for continued benefits over the policy term. You can get discounts on purchasing a policy for 2 years. The premium discount is applicable for second year for Heartbeat and Health Companion Health Insurance plans.

items.question: What types of medical expenses are compensated by Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: All treatment expenses during hospitalisation are covered under Max Bupa Health Insurance plans including room rent charges.

items.question: Is it necessary to undergo a medical checkup before buying Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: A medical checkup may be required at the time of purchasing a policy but not at the time of renewal. It is advisable to undergo a medical checkup and disclosing any pre-existing conditions at the time of policy inception to avoid any hassle when making a claim.

items.question: Can I avail cashless facility across all the hospitals?
items.answer: No, cashless hospitalisation can be availed only at a network hospital of Max Bupa Health Insurance.

items.question: What is the procedure to avail medical benefits under insurance policy?
items.answer: Max Bupa Health Insurance offers a hassle-free claim process whether it is a cashless claim or reimbursement claim. In the case of a cashless claim, the network hospital has to send a pre-authorisation request to the insurer. In the case of a reimbursement claim, after discharge, you can submit the duly-filled claim form along with the original hospital bills to the insurer. In both cases, the insurer will review your claim request and approve or reject the claim accordingly.

items.question: Who is TPA of Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: Max Bupa Health Insurance doesn't have a Third-Party Administrator. This way, the claim settlement solutions are direct and quicker.

items.question: What is a pre-existing disease or condition under Max Bupa Health Insurance?
items.answer: Any illness, injury, disease or condition detected, treated or diagnosed before 48 hours of purchasing the policy is considered a pre-existing condition.

items.question: Does Max Bupa Health Insurance cover the hospitalization expenses incurred during a medical emergency?
items.answer: Insurance cover of a health insurance policy offered by Max Bupa is only for medical expen

elements.body:
Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance is one of the most trusted insurance companies in India which boasts of a plethora of insurance portfolio ranging from protection plans to retirement plans, annuity plans, group plans, to saving cum protection plans.

Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance Company Limited is one of the nation's fastest growing insurance providers. The company was formerly known as the Kotak Mahindra Old Mutual Life Insurance Limited. As of March 2018, Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance Company covers over 20 million people across the country.

sections.title: Benefits of Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance:

elements.body: Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance Limited is one of the leading insurers in India. It has been touted as one of the quickest growing insurance organisations in the country, with more than 4 million policyholders across India. The company has designed a number of unique products and services to meet the ever-changing financial needs of a diverse customer base. Whether you are looking for protection plans, savings and investment instruments, retirement plans or child plans, Kotak Mahindra's portfolio is certain to make it relatively easy in finding the best product for you. The company offers solutions for group entities as well as individuals, ensuring that no matter what your investment requirements are, there is something that will help you meet your long-term goals. Kotak Mahindra also holds the distinction of having among the best claim settlement ratios in the industry, thereby giving us a glimpse of its quality business practices.

sections.title: Different Types of Life Insurance Policies Offered by Kotak Mahindra:

elements.body: Limited has become of the leading insurers in India for many reasons, one of which is the company's quality products. Not only does the company offer solutions that help in meeting your long-term objectives, but it also has a vast portfolio that can help customers find the perfect policy whether they seek protection, savings and investment plans, child plans or retirement solutions. Following are the different kinds of life insurance policies offered by Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance Company.

sections.title: Kotak Mahindra Protection Plans:

elements.body:
The protection plans made available by Kotak Mahindra are designed in a manner such that they not only ensure that your family is financially secure in the event of your untimely demise, but it also helps in ensuring that the emotional well-being of your family is not too adversely affected whilst helping them live debt-free. Following are the protection plans offered by Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance Limited:

  1. Kotak Saral Suraksha: This is a term plan that provides a significant cover at affordable premiums. Premiums can be paid over a period of 5 years either annually or biannually. Policyholders can also make a single lump sum premium payment. An additional benefit of this plan is that it does not require a lot of paperwork.
  2. Kotak e-Term Plan: The e-Term plan is a pure risk cover term plan that provides the insured with high protection at a nominal cost. The insured can choose from a number of plan options and multiple payout options. Policyholders can either increase or decrease their cover based on their requirement.
  3. Kotak Term Plan: The Kotak Mahindra Term Plan offers the insured with a high level of protection at affordable prices. Policyholders also have the flexibility of making premium payments on a yearly, half-yearly, quarterly, or monthly basis. An added advantage of this plan is that the policyholder can convert their term plan to other types of life plans offered by Kotak Mahindra.
  4. Kotak Income Protection Plan: The Income Protection Plan provides the insured a monthly income that continues to increase at compounding 6% p.a. The monthly payouts can be availed after 5 years of the policy's term. Dependents of the insured receive the lump sum amount of the sum assured if the insured passes away during the term of the policy.

sections.title: Kotak Mahindra Savings and Investment Plans:

elements.body:
The Kotak Mahindra savings and investment plans offered by Kotak Mahindra offer a number of avenues through which customers can save and earn money. The systematic manner in which your funds are invested in these plans ensure that policyholder and his / her family have enough money to meet their financial targets. Following are the savings and investment plans you can avail from Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance Limited:

  1. Kotak Gramin Bima Yojana: This plan requires the insured to make a single premium payment of a nominal amount. The Gramin Bima Yojana plan has been designed to meet the needs of the rural sector. Policyholders get a guaranteed payout on maturity of the policy.
  2. Kotak Sampoorn Bima Micro-Insurance: The Sampoorn Bima Micro-Insurance plan requires the insured to make a single premium payment of Rs.200. The plan ensures a payout on maturity.
  3. Kotak Classic Endowment Plan: This participating endowment plan provides the insured with protection up to the age of 75 years. Policyholders receive a bonus every year from the first year of the policy. The plan allows the insured to make premium payments as per their suitability. Policyholders who opt for a high sum assured receive a discount.
  4. Kotak Premier Endowment Plan: The Premier Endowment plan provides the insured with guaranteed additions at 5% p.a. of the basic sum assured within the first 5 years of the policy's tenure. Policyholders receive a bonus that accrues from the 6th year of the policy's term. The plan provides the insured with the flexibility to select their premium payment options.
  5. Kotak Assured Income Plan: This plan provides the insured with assured annual income for 15 years if the insured survives the term of their policy. A percentage of the sum assured is paid in lump sum to the insured on the maturity of the policy. The protection is extended to a fixed term of 30 years.
  6. Kotak Assured Income Accelerator: This plan provides the insured with a guaranteed income that is payable annually. Income boosters are provided to the insured at 5% to 7% on an annual basis. The insured is also given the death benefit regardless of the guaranteed income that is paid during the tenure of the policy.
  7. Kotak Premier Moneyback Plan: Depending on the policy term chosen by the insured, a percentage of the sum assured is paid out as regular cash backs at specified intervals. A lump sum amount is paid out in addition to the maturity benefit at the end of the policy's term. Bonuses declared are paid out from the end of the first year of the policy's term. An additional sum is paid out in instances where the insured passes away due to an accident.
  8. Kotak Premier Income Plan: The Premier Income Plan provides the insured with guaranteed annual income immediately after making the premium payment. Female policyholders receive a greater sum assured. Additionally, policyholders have the benefit of accruing bonuses during the tenure of the plan.
  9. Kotak Guaranteed Savings Plan: This non-linked, non-participating life insurance plan The plan comes with a limited premium payment option that provides guaranteed additions accrued over the term of the policy. A lump sum amount is paid as loyalty additions at the end of the plan's tenure.
  10. Kotak Premier Life Plan: This is a whole life plan that provides the insured with coverage up to the age of 99 years. Policyholders can receive bonuses as a lump sum payout. On choosing a high sum assured, policyholders receive a discount on premium payments.
  11. Kotak Assured Savings Plan: Policyholders receive the sum assured and accrued yearly additions as the maturity benefit. Increase in premium payment term earns the policyholder guaranteed loyalty additions and yearly additions.
  12. Kotak Single Invest Plus: The Single Invest Plus plan requires the policyholder to make a one-time premium payment. It provides a joint cover for both the insured and another family member. Policyholders receive loyalty additions at the end of the 10th and 15th year of the policy's term. The plan gives policyholders the freedom to invest in a variety of funds.
  13. Kotak Wealth Insurance: This plan provides the policyholder with the chance of accumulating wealth through returns from investments. In the event of the policyholder's death, the dependents receive 100% of the sum assured in addition to a lump sum amount of the fund value. Policyholders can customise their portfolio based on the risks they are willing to take. The terms of the policy permit the insured to make partial withdrawals to meet any unexpected life events.
  14. Kotak Invest Maxima: Policyholders have the freedom of choosing the funds they want to invest in. The plan offers policyholders 2 choices of investment strategies: Self-managed and systematic switching strategy. Policyholders receive rewards for long-term plans. The plan also permits the insured the flexibility of making premium payments.
  15. Kotak Single Invest Advantage: The Single Invest Advantage plan requires the policyholder to make one premium payment throughout the term of the policy. Policyholders can choose from 3 investment strategies.
  16. Kotak Platinum Plan: This policy provides the policyholder with the opportunity to capitalise their investments and build a substantial corpus through the investment strategies available. 95% to 98.5% of the premium paid is invested in the investment instruments chosen by the policyholder. Additionally, policyholders also earn survival units, which is equal to 2% of the average fund value, at the end of the 10th year of the policy's tenure and every 5 years thereafter.
  17. Kotak Ace Investment: The Kotak Ace Investment plan provides policyholders with the option of choosing from a variety of investment strategies. The cover can be decided as per the requirement of the policyholder. The plan can be enhanced through the riders available. Policyholders have an added advantage of making partial withdrawals to meet unplanned expenditure.
  18. Kotak Smart Life Plan: This plan provides the insured with a life cover upto the age of 75 years. Bonus options can be chosen by the policyholder from the first year of the policy's term. The protection of the plan can be enhanced through riders.
  19. Kotak POS Bachat Bima: The POS Bachat Bima plan gives the policyholder 2 plan options. The Life Plus option provides a cover for accidental death. Policyholders can be assured of annual additions that accrue throughout the policy's term.

sections.title: Kotak Mahindra Child Plans:

elements.body:
Child plans are a great way to invest in the future of your child and ensure that you have adequate finances to meet expenses related to their higher education, marriage, etc. Kotak Mahindra currently has only one child plan that can be purchased to get a head start on your child's future. Following is a brief description of the same:

  1. Kotak Headstart Child Assure: A ULIP plan with three benefits - death benefits, maturity benefits, and premium waiver in case of death of parent (insured).

sections.title: Kotak Mahindra Retirement Plans:

elements.body:
Kotak Mahindra Retirement plans are designed to provide a regular source of income to the policyholder once he / she has retired from work. These plans enable you to save money in a systematic manner so that you have enough funds to follow your dreams or take your family on an exotic vacation. Following are the three retirement plans you can purchase from Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance Limited:

  1. Kotak Lifetime Income Plan: Immediate annuity plan that secures your financial future post-retirement. Flexible frequencies of payouts available.
  2. Kotak e-Lifetime Income Plan: A single premium immediate annuity plan that offers lifetime income through four options available. The plan can be applied for online and the annuity rate remains unchanged throughout the policy term.
  3. Kotak Premier Pension Plus: The Premier Pension Plan from Kotak Mahindra enable you to accumulate money for your retirement, thus ensuring that you continue to live a comfortable life and have no worries about money as you will receive a regular income to carry on with life.

sections.title: Kotak Mahindra Group Plans:

elements.body:
Kotak Mahindra Group plans are designed to strengthen the relationship between employers and employees. Not only do these plans provide customers with life cover, but also ensure that they have a comfortable life post retirement by means of pension and gratuity plans. Following are the various group plans offered by Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance Company:

Group Gratuity/Leave Encashment Plans

These plans help policyholders invest their funds to better cover any potential liabilities of their employees.

  1. Kotak Gratuity Plus Group Plan: This plan assures returns of all contributions made by the policyholder at the time of exit. The plan provides the policyholder's employees with a life cover in addition to gratuity benefit. The policy is renewable on a yearly basis.
  2. Kotak Secure Return Employee Benefit Plan: This plan serves a dual purpose of serving the requirements of both gratuity and leave encashment. Policyholders are guaranteed a minimum 2% floor rate p.a. for the entire policy term. Additional life covers can be added to the group plan. The policy can be renewed on an annual basis.
  3. Kotak Gratuity Group Plan: This plan helps employers reduce the business costs and meet the needs of funding gratuity. The unit-linked plan provides long-term investment growth and provides exposure to a number of markets. The policy can be renewed on an annual basis.
  4. Kotak Leave Encashment Group Plan: This plan provides employers with the opportunity to invest in a variety of market-linked funds. The plan helps employers fund leave encashment and reducing financial strain. In addition to leave encashment, the plan also comes with a life cover.

Group Superannuation Plans

The group superannuation plans offered by Kotak have been created to provide employees with retirement benefits. The following are the plans that Kotak Mahindra offers:

  1. Kotak Secure Return Superannuation Plan: This plan helps with all requirements related to superannuation. The plan assures a 2% minimum floor rate p.a. The employer can also provide their employees with an additional life cover through this plan. The plan can be renewed every year.

The plan caters to needs of both the employer and the employees. Contributions made to the plan are invested in Group Secure Capital Fund and provides regular monthly additions.

Group Term Plans

The group term plan helps employers provide plans that empowers and protects the loved ones of their employees in the event of their untimely death. The following are the group term plans offered by Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance:

  1. Kotak Group Secure Plan: This is a pure term group plan that builds loyalty from employees by providing financial security to the dependents of the employee. The plan is available in 2 variants, one of which also covers terminal illness. The plan is best suited for individuals employed with any associations.
  2. Kotak Credit Term Group Plan: This plan eases the financial burden that family members are likely to face in the event of the death of the employee who has existing loans. The plan can be renewed on an annual basis.
  3. Kotak Term Group Plan: This plan provides a life cover to employees and a voluntary life cover can also be extended to family members of the employee. The plan can be enhanced through riders. The plans can also be customized by the employer and provides flexibility with regard to premium payment.
  4. Kotak Raksha Group Micro Insurance Plan: This plan provides the employer with the flexibility of choosing cover options based on the requirements of the employee. Employees have the option of choosing either a single cover or a joint cover. Premium payments can be made based on the convenience of the employer.
  5. Kotak Group Secure One Plan: This plan provides the employer with a comprehensive life cover for their employees. This plan is best suited for individuals who work in government offices, NGOs, Co-operative Societies and other similar organizations.

Group Credit Plans

The Group Credit plans offered by Kotak not only provide a life cover but also protects the family members of the employee from any loan liabilities in the event of the employee's death. The following are the plans that Kotak Mahindra offers:

  1. Kotak Group Assure: This plan protects the family members of the employee from any loan liabilities in the event of the employee's death. The plan also provides protection against disability, terminal and critical illnesses. The plan has a number of variants that the employer can choose.
  2. Kotak Group Shield: The cover provided for this plan that is the same amount as the initial loan amount taken by the policyholder. The plan provides financial security to the dependents of the employee by taking care of any loan repayments. The plan also provides a cover against terminal illness, critical illness, and disability.
  3. Kotak Complete Cover Group Plan: This plan is best suited for institutions that offer credit. The plan protects the institution from any loan liabilities following the death of the borrower. Additionally, the plan also provides financial security to the borrower's family members. An advantage to this plan is the single premium payment that can help manage the borrower's account.
